official-title.#text:
Honoring the Good Friday Agreement (the
		  Belfast Agreement), on the 15th anniversary of its ratification, as the
		  framework for lasting peace in Northern Ireland.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
supports the goals and ideals of the Good
			 Friday Agreement;

urges all
			 communities to continue to engage in the legal political process;

calls on the
			 Governments of the United Kingdom and Ireland to work together to achieve full
			 implementation of the Good Friday Agreement, including the creation of a Bill
			 of Rights for Northern Ireland; and

recognizes the
			 urgent and ongoing necessity of reconciliation, and urges the involvement of
			 the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, and communities to work toward
			 genuine reconciliation.

Whereas the Good Friday Agreement demonstrated democratic
			 and peaceful means of resolving differences;

Whereas members of both political parties in the United
			 States came together to support the Good Friday Agreement; and

Whereas the Good Friday Agreement promotes religious
			 freedom, democracy, and human rights: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 233 IH: Honoring the Good Friday Agreement (the Belfast Agreement), on the 15th anniversary of its ratification, as the framework for lasting peace in Northern Ireland.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
